intro: Velleia macrocalyx, commonly known as the large-flowered velleia, is a species of flowering plant in the Asteraceae family. It is native to the southeastern United States, particularly Florida and parts of Georgia. The plant is characterized by its showy, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters during the summer months. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture. Velleia macrocalyx thrives in moist, sunny habitats such as wetlands and swamp edges.
